form.instruction:
You need to make sure the cardinal number words in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Num. Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have numbers marked with the category Num in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If numbers are mixed in with another category in the lexicon (e.g. adjectives), you either need to give them the category Num in your morphological parser, or add the feature makeNum to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax.
If you have numbers marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Num, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Num.
Num
Run the file qptest.txt through your morphological parser and then run the syntactic parser on the output. Check the log for the results and note any changes you need to make to the lexicon or to answers about the order of elements in the phrase structure rules. Make the changes as needed and rerun.
(Note: some examples cannot be tested until you complete
Simple and Possessed Nominal Phrases.)
Please check off this section now in 'Contents' and then proceed to
Adverbs and AdvP when you are ready.
